article_title: Trinity Health Will Centralize Control of its Medical Supply Chain
article_text:
Trinity Health, one of the country’s largest Catholic health-care systems, is taking greater control of its supply chain by building its own distribution network.

The new setup, which starts with a distribution hub in Fort Wayne, Ind., would cut $20 million a year in costs, the health system said this week. The announcement comes as the health-care industry has seen a wave of consolidation in recent years as companies seek to gain...

twitter.description: Trinity Health will centralize control of its medical supply chain under a 10-year pact with XPO Logistics to create and manage a distribution hub in Indiana and satellite sites around the U.S.
twitter.creator: @lorettachao

image.alt: Trinity Health will centralize control of its medical supply chain
